title: 114_hr4461
content: The "Federal Employee Rights Act" may be cited as the short title of this Act. It addresses labor organization dues for federal employees. The "Federal Employee Rights Act" prohibits agencies from deducting labor organization dues from employee pay and using appropriated funds for such deductions. The term 'agency' includes Executive agencies, the United States Postal Service, the Postal Regulatory Commission, and offices in the legislative branch. The "Federal Employee Rights Act" prohibits the use of employee dues for political purposes unless authorized in writing after a notice period. The authorization expires within one year and does not automatically renew. The "Federal Employee Rights Act" prohibits the use of employee dues for non-collective bargaining purposes without written authorization, which expires within a year and does not automatically renew. The "Federal Employee Rights Act" requires written authorization for the use of employee dues for non-collective bargaining purposes, with a one-year expiration and no automatic renewal. Title 5 of the United States Code is amended accordingly. Title 39 of the United States Code is amended by removing section 1205 and replacing it with a new section related to labor organization dues. The amendments made by section 1205 prohibit the use of dues for political purposes. The effective date of these amendments is the date of enactment, with transition provisions for existing assignments of dues. The section prohibits the use of dues for political purposes and includes transition provisions for existing assignments of dues. It clarifies that current deductions for dues of other labor organizations will not terminate before the underlying agreement ceases to have effect. The section prohibits the use of dues for political purposes and includes transition provisions for existing assignments of dues. It clarifies that current deductions for dues of a labor organization from postal service employees will not terminate before the assignment expires or is revoked. The agreement between an agency and a labor organization regarding dues payment shall not be renewed or extended. Postal service assignments of dues or agreements with employee organizations will not expire prematurely. The agreement between an agency and a labor organization regarding dues payment shall not be subject to renewal or extension. Definitions for terms like "agency", "exclusive representative", and "labor organization" are provided in section 7103 of title 5, United States Code. "Require majority vote of employees in a unit to join union." Amendments to title 5 and title 39 of the United States Code require a majority vote of employees in a unit to join a union. The amendments increase the required percentage from 30% to more than 50% in certain sections. These changes apply to elections or petitions filed after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 4. USE OF PERSONAL INFORMATION. Amends title 5 and title 39 of the United States Code to allow employees to withhold personal information from a labor organization during organizing activities. SEC. 5. REQUIREMENT FOR SECRET PAPER BALLOT ELECTIONS. Amends title 5 and title 39 of the United States Code to mandate secret paper ballot elections for any election under this chapter.
